meanings.definition: A person who sets or follows a limit or boundary, especially in terms of speed or performance.
meanings.sent1: The redliner always makes sure to drive at the exact speed limit.
meanings.sent2: The race car driver was known as a redliner for always pushing the vehicle to its maximum speed.
meanings.sent3: The redliner decided to challenge themselves by running a marathon in record time.
meanings.sent4: She was a redliner in her dedication to achieving top scores in every exam.
meanings.sent5: The redliner's commitment to never giving up made them a role model for others.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that indicates when a certain limit has been reached or exceeded.
meanings.sent1: The redliner on the treadmill beeped loudly when the runner reached their set distance.
meanings.sent2: The fuel gauge in the car acted as a redliner, warning the driver when the tank was almost empty.
meanings.sent3: The redliner on the oven timer alerted the baker that the cookies were perfectly baked.
meanings.sent4: The redliner on the thermometer signaled that the temperature had risen above normal levels.
meanings.sent5: The redliner on the speedometer flashed as the car accelerated beyond the safe limit.
